comments.content:
After talking with @amcrn on irc it looks like the error comes from devstack setting FORCE_CONFIG_DRIVE on by default. 

https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/commit/385775d83fb61132098a3b117f1aaa8a8612a972

So we could solve this 3 ways..
1. The patch i submitted above. (chmod +r /etc/guest_info) in the guest upstart script
2. Set the variable to false in the rc file for devstack. 
3. Push up a bug to nova that the file permissions change between injecting files with config drive on or off.

#3 seems to be the most logical unless there is push back that this is by design.
Otherwise i think we should probably accept my patch since we want to work with vanilla devstack install.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~cp16net

comments.content:
Craig,

Config Drive itself does not create the /etc/guest_info file on the deployed vm. It's probably cloud-init right? Config Drive is responsible for creating the directory/files on the ISO that gets generated. 

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py#L2445
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/virt/configdrive.py#L88

Can you please look closer at option #3? not sure what change we can make if any

-- dims
